domain.description: The field of knowledge or practice the rule set applies to (e.g., software engineering, medicine).

context.description: The task or activity in which the rule set is applied (e.g., debugging, code review, diagnosis).

constraint.description: The limitation, risk, or compliance condition the rule set enforces (e.g., policy, legal requirement).

tone.description: The output voice, style, or level of formality (e.g., direct, explanatory, friendly).

persona.description: The behavioral or professional role the rule set emulates (e.g., mentor, peer, executive).

audience.description: The intended recipient of the rule set's outputs (e.g., beginner, technical peer, stakeholder).

tool.description: The software platform or medium the rule set targets (e.g., GitHub, Figma, Jupyter).

method.description: The reasoning or problem-solving approach the rule set encourages (e.g., stepwise, analogy).

language.description: The natural language used for output (e.g., English, Japanese).
